page.title: 06 A FARMER'S DAY
page.content: The day begins at 7:30 a.m. when he arrives for work. The machines, tractors etc. are then started for the day. Work continues until 10:00 when he stops for his "docky" break, with tea or coffee from a flask and a light snack until 10:30. Work continues until 1:00 on a range of jobs depending on the time of year. These include crop spraying, ploughing, sugar beet lifting, maintenance work, planting, combining, straw baling, straw burning, muck carting and spreading. From 1:00 to 1:30 is dinner break. Afternoon work commences at 1:30 and continues until 4:30 when the farmer finishes for the day and returns home for his main meal.In some seasons and at corn cutting time more hours are worked but with the aid of the modern machinery the day is shorter.
